intro: Cephalanthus glabrifolius, commonly known as the smoothleaf sweet pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, where it thrives in moist, wooded areas. The plant is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. Its fruit is a small, round, red berry that ripens in late summer. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
